annotation.TEXT: Although I would normally wonder how I managed to perfect a boss I had so much trouble with before, I think I'm more concerned with the fact that Plague Knight apparently invented the Krazy Straw.

Probably a bit of overkill with the War Horn there, but I felt it was necessary. You seriously don't want to know how many times I died in this section while practicing on my other save file. Between the propeller enemy and the flames, I was always hit by one of them and went right into the pit.

I wouldn't really bother using the Ornate Plate under most circumstances, but it actually does serve a very minor purpose in the next stage (mostly for triggering some optional dialogue). Speaking of which, the next stage is generally what I consider to be the hardest level in the game. It more or less has almost every major gimmick rolled into one gauntlet, all leading up to a climax of segments that can be downright nasty at times (especially if it's your first time going through it).

Before I move on to the next stage, there's still one last thing to collect (that's not a part of the main stages). Earlier, I intentionally skipped out on purchasing the Ornate Plate from the armor outpost. The plate itself doesn't do anything beyond cosmetic effects (as hinted at with its description). It essentially turns most of your jumps into acrobatic flips, along with creating a sparkling trail in the process.

While I would normally cut this part out in any other game, Shovel Knight's boss rush/re-fights work a bit differently when compared to Mega Man's. For one, you fight each boss in a semi-random order (there seem to be a few set bosses that can go first, such as Tinker Knight and Polar Knight). Beyond that, this also gives me the chance to properly get that "Untouched" achievement I missed out on from Tinker Knight's stage (don't take any damage while facing an Order of No Quarter boss), along with showing off a few other tricks here and there.

While you can leave the Order to hang here, it's actually a better idea to save them. Doing so actually allows you to talk with them for a bit of optional conversation. If you happen to be wearing the Ornate Plate, you'll also get a compliment from King Knight at the end of his usual dialogue.
